newsitem.title: PAKISTAN: Pakistan cotton rates steady amid low demand.
newsitem.headline: Pakistan cotton rates steady amid low demand.

text.p: Pakistan cotton rates were steady on Thursday amid low demand from spinners and may come off in the next few days owing to high supplies, dealers said.
They said ginners were sitting on large stocks of unsold cotton from the 1996/97 crop and the arrival of new crop was due in June.

Pakistan Cotton Ginners Association said the 1996/97 cotton output had reached a provisional 8.761 million 375-lb bales by May 1, down from 9.938 million in the same time a year ago. Ginners have some 902,000 unsold bales of cotton, it said.
